greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A partition product with biggest-part statistic of Stirling_1 type (with parameter k = -2) as well as of Stirling_2 type (with parameter k = -2), (triangle read by rows).
comment: Partition product of prod_{j=0..n-1}((k+1)*j - 1) and n! at k = -2, summed over parts with equal biggest part (Stirling_2 type) as well as partition product of prod_{j=0..n-2}(k-n+j+2) and n! at k = -2 (Stirling_1 type).
It shares this property with the signless Lah numbers.
Same partition product with length statistic is A105278.
formula: T(n,0) = [n = 0] (Iverson notation) and for n > 0 and 1 <= m <= n
T(n,m) = Sum_{a} M(a)|f^a| where a = a_1,..,a_n such that
OR f_n = product_{j=0..n-2}(j-n) since both have the same absolute value n!.
E.g.f. of column k: exp((x^(k+1)-x)/(x-1))-exp((x^k-x)/(x-1)). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 10 2015
maple: T:= (n, k)-> n!*coeff(series(egf(k), x, n+1), x, n):
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 10 2015
mathematica: egf[k_] := Exp[(x^(k+1)-x)/(x-1)] - Exp[(x^k-x)/(x-1)]; T[n_, k_] := n! * SeriesCoefficient[egf[k], {x, 0, n}]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 11 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Mar 09 2009, Mar 14 2009
